sen.j: 輸租田（ゆそでん）とは、律令制における田地の課税方式の区分のうち、田租を国家へ納めることが定められた田。
sen.e: The term "Yusoden" means rice fields on which denso (rice field tax) was imposed under the taxation system of Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on Ritsuryo Code).
The term "Yusoden" means rice fields on which denso (rice field tax) was imposed under the taxation system of Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo Code).
The term "Yusoden" means rice fields on which denso (rice field tax) was imposed under the taxation system of Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo Code).

sen.j: 田租は大宝律令では1段につき2束2把、慶雲3年9月10日 (旧暦)（706年10月21日）格式では1束5把に改められた。
sen.e: The amount of denso was nitaba-niwa (two sheaves and two bunches) per a dan (about 992 ㎡)of rice field under Taiho Code and it was revised to hitotaba-gowa (one sheaves and five bunches) by Kakushiki (amendment of Ritsuryo Code) dated October 21, 706.
sen.cmt: 段、2束2把、1束5把→読み、定訳不明
sen.e: The amount of denso was nitaba-niwa (two sheaves and two bunches) per a dan (about 992 ㎡)of rice field under Taiho Code and it was revised to hitotaba-gowa (one sheaves and five bunches) by Kakushiki (amendment of Ritsuryo Code) dated October 21, 706.

The amount of denso was nitaba-niwa (two sheaves and two bunches) per a dan (about 992 ㎡)of rice field under Taiho Code and it was revised to hitotaba-gowa (one sheaves and five bunches) by Kakushiki (amendment of Ritsuryo Code) dated October 21, 706.

sen.j: これは度量衡の変更によるもので実質的にはほぼ同量と言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the above revision was made only because of the change of the system of weighs and measures and the actual amount remained unchanged.
It is said that the above revision was made only because of the change of the system of weighs and measures and the actual amount remained unchanged.
It is said that the above revision was made only because of the change of the system of weighs and measures and the actual amount remained unchanged.

sen.j: 毎年稲の収穫が終わる9月 (旧暦)から11月 (旧暦)にかけて輸租田から国衙に田租が納入された。
sen.e: Denso was delivered from Yusoden to kokuga (provincial government offices) from September (old calendar) to November (old calendar) every year when rice was harvested.
Denso was delivered from Yusoden to kokuga (provincial government offices) from September (old calendar) to November (old calendar) every year when rice was harvested.
Denso was delivered from Yusoden to kokuga (provincial government offices) from September (old calendar) to November (old calendar) every year when rice was harvested.

sen.j: また、これに付随して正税・出挙が合わせて賦課された。
sen.e: In addition to denso, shozei (rice tax) and suiko (seed rice used for government loan system) were also imposed.
In addition to denso, shozei (rice tax) and suiko (seed rice used for government loan system) were also imposed.
In addition to denso, shozei (rice tax) and suiko (seed rice used for government loan system) were also imposed.

sen.j: これに対して田租を納め無い田を不輸租田と呼ぶ（ただし、いずれにも属しない輸地子田（乗田・無主田・収公田など田租の替わりに地子を納める田地）も存在する）。
sen.e: On the other hand, rice fields which were exempted from denso were called fuyusoden (provided that rice fields which didn't belong either of the above two categories called yujishiden (such as joden, mushuden and shukoden on which jishi (land tax) was imposed instead of denso) also existed).
sen.cmt: 乗田・無主田・収公田→読み、定訳不明
sen.e: On the other hand, rice fields which were exempted from denso were called fuyusoden (provided that rice fields which didn't belong either of the above two categories called yujishiden (such as joden, mushuden and shukoden on which jishi (land tax) was imposed instead of denso) also existed).

On the other hand, rice fields which were exempted from denso were called fuyusoden (provided that rice fields which didn't belong either of the above two categories called yujishiden (such as joden, mushuden and shukoden on which jishi (land tax) was imposed instead of denso) also existed).

sen.j: 輸租田と不輸租田の区別は時期によっても異なるが、通説では口分田・位田・功田・賜田・国造田・郡司職田・墾田が輸租田、職田・公廨田・駅起田・官田・寺田・神田・釆女田が不輸租田にあたる。
sen.e: Though the distinction between yosoden and fuyusoden varied depending on the times, it is commonly understand that kubunden (rice fields given to each peasant), iden (rice fields given based on the court rank), shiden (rice fields given by the Emperor), kokuzoden (rice fields given to local officials), gunjishikiden (rice fields given to gunji (local magistrate) and konden (newly developed rice fields) were categorized as yosoden and shikiden (rice fields given to high-ranking officials), kugaiden, ekiden, kanden (imperial rice fields), jiden (rice fields associated with temples), shinden (rice fields associated with shrines) and unemeden were categorized as fuyusoden.
sen.cmt: 公廨田・駅起田・釆女田→定訳不明
sen.e: Though the distinction between yosoden and fuyusoden varied depending on the times, it is commonly understand that kubunden (rice fields given to each peasant), iden (rice fields given based on the court rank), shiden (rice fields given by the Emperor), kokuzoden (rice fields given to local officials), gunjishikiden (rice fields given to gunji (local magistrate) and konden (newly developed rice fields) were categorized as yosoden and shikiden (rice fields given to high-ranking officials), kugaiden, ekiden, kanden (imperial rice fields), jiden (rice fields associated with temples), shinden (rice fields associated with shrines) and unemeden were categorized as fuyusoden.

Though the distinction between yusoden and fuyusoden varied depending on the times, it is commonly understood that kubunden (rice fields given to each peasant), iden (rice fields given based on the court rank), kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state), shiden (rice fields given by the Emperor), kokuzoden (rice fields given to local officials), gunjishikiden (rice fields given to gunji (local magistrate) and konden (newly developed rice fields) were categorized as yosoden and shikiden (rice fields given to high-ranking officials), kugaiden, ekiden, kanden (imperial rice fields), jiden (rice fields associated with temples), shinden (rice fields associated with shrines) and unemeden were categorized as fuyusoden.

sen.j: 班田制の衰退とともに田地の課税方式自体が変質し、輸祖田と輸地子田が公田、田租と地子が租穀として一括把握されるようになった。
sen.e: According to the decline of handensei (Ritsuryo land allotment system), taxation system of rice fields itself changed and eventually, yusoden and fuyusoden were integrated into koden (rice fields administered directly by a ruler) and denso and jishi were integrated into sokoku.

According to the decline of handensei (Ritsuryo land allotment system), taxation system of rice fields itself changed and eventually, yusoden and fuyusoden were integrated into koden (rice fields administered directly by a ruler) and denso and jishi were integrated into sokoku.

According to the decline of handensei (Ritsuryo land allotment system), taxation system of rice fields itself changed and eventually, yusoden and yujishiden were integrated into koden (rice fields administered directly by a ruler) and denso and jishi were integrated into sokoku.

sen.j: 租穀は1段につき3斗（6束に相当）が基準とされたが、実際の賦課は一定では無かった。
sen.e: Although the standard amount of sokoku was santo (about 54 litres) (equivalent to six sheaves), actually imposed amount was not constant.
Although the standard amount of sokoku was santo (about fifty-four litres) (equivalent to six sheaves), the actual imposed amount was not constant.
Although the standard amount of sokoku was santo (about fifty-four liters) (equivalent to six sheaves), the actual imposed amount was not constant.

sen.j: それに対して11世紀に導入された賦課基準が公田官物率法であった。
sen.e: Under such situation, a new standard called Koden kanmotsu rippo (the law fixing the tax rate for koden) was introduced in the 11th century.
Under such situation, a new standard called Koden kanmotsu rippo (the law fixing the tax rate for koden) was introduced in the eleventh century.
Under such situation, a new standard called Koden kanmotsu rippo (the law fixing the tax rate for koden) was introduced in the eleventh century.

sen.j: 輸租田に該当する田地はたとえ権門所有の荘園であったとしても田租が徴収された。
sen.e: Rice fields categorized as yusoden were imposed denso even though they were influential families' shoen (manor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Rice fields categorized as yusoden were imposed denso even though they were influential families' shoen (manor).
Rice fields categorized as yusoden were imposed denso even though they were influential families' shoen (manor).

sen.j: しかし、10世紀に入ると権門が太政官符・民部省符によって不輸の権 (日本)を獲得して，所有する荘園を事実上の不輸租田とした。
sen.e: In the 10th century, however, these influential families obtained fuyu no ken (the right of tax exemption) by Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State)/Minbushofu (official documents issued by Minbusho, Ministry of Popular Affaires) and converted their shoen into fuyusoden in effect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In the tenth century, however, these influential families obtained fuyu no ken (the right of tax exemption) by Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State)/Minbushofu (official documents issued by Minbusho, Ministry of Popular Affaires) and converted their shoen into fuyusoden in effect.

In the tenth century, however, these influential families obtained fuyu no ken (the right of tax exemption) by Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State)/Minbushofu (official documents issued by Minbusho, Ministry of Popular Affaires) and converted their shoen into fuyusoden in effect.

sen.j: これを官省符荘と呼ぶ。
sen.e: These shoen were called Kanshofu sho (shoen exempted from tax by Daijokanpu/Minbushofu).
These shoen were called Kanshofu sho (shoen exempted from tax by Daijokanpu/Minbushofu).
These shoen were called Kanshofu sho (shoen exempted from tax by Daijokanpu/Minbushofu).

sen.j: これに対して輸租田の回復を目指して出されたのが荘園整理令であった。
sen.e: In order to cope with such situation, Shoen seirirei (decree restricting the expansion of shoen) was issued.
In order to cope with such a situation, Shoen seirirei (decree restricting the expansion of shoen) was issued.
In order to cope with such a situation, Shoen seirirei (decree restricting the expansion of shoen) was issued.
